website_summaries.verdict: Our highest-rated pair: well worth the extra investment, these shoes provide everything wearers expect including comfort and style.
pros: Stands out for its gel cushioning system that optimizes shock absorption
Glows in the dark to maximize safety when running at night
cons: Runs one half to one full size small

customer_reviews.title: To Smal...
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered the same size Gel-Nimbus as long as I can remember. These seem to be a size smaller. I put them on and they were far to snug. Toe Box was cramped. I most likely will go into the local store to try on a few different sizes of these and see if maybe the next size up fits like my normal size. If not, I will be switching to a new brand shoe. I need a neutral shoe and there isn't many decent ones to pick from from Asics.
customer_reviews.author: jamala00

customer_reviews.title: Asics goes backwards in shoe fit and quality - too bad.
customer_reviews.text: 4th generation of Gel-Nimbus (started with 15's) and these Gel-Nimbus 19's are definitely narrower than previous generations. I always get 2E, may have to get 4E from now on. I'm hopeful the gel and foam will hold up better than Gel-Nimbus 18's which broke down terribly, sounding like popping corn during running and walking. It's unfortunate Asics has gone backwards and not forward with the generations. I think the best generation was Gel-Nimbus 17's. Wish they were available. I'll give these a month but may which to Mizuno going forward.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been very disappointed the the fit and the quality of materials. I have been a long time runner and have almost always worn Asics Gel-Nimbus running shoes. This will be my last pair. I started years ago with my first Half Marathon in the Gel-Nimbus 3's and now they are up to the 20's. After the poor performances of the 18 and 19's I will look to another brand. This after only 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Jay Peters

customer_reviews.title: Disaster for what was the best stability running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. I’ve run 29 marathons and dozens of other races in the past 15 years. Almost all of them, I’ve run in the Gel Nimbus. It has been my go to shoe for my running career. The 19 sizing is awful. My toes are cramped beyond comprehension and it just doesn’t breathe and respond like its earlier models. Team ASICS: you need to look in the mirror, admit this is a disaster, and fix it. I’ve moved to the Nike Air Vomero and the Saucony Triumph.
customer_reviews.author: Dad in Naperville, IL

customer_reviews.title: Seem to Run Small
customer_reviews.text: My usual shoe size is 11.5W. ASICS doesn't list this size for the Nimbus 19. I tried a pair of the 11.5 Std. Width and they were too short. The size 12 4E, I ordered and received, fit as expected (good) with green Super Feet inserts. To be comfortable with two pairs of socks, I could probably have gone up another size.
customer_reviews.author: W. Matthaei

customer_reviews.title: Asics made this model/version smaller, now tight at my toes.
customer_reviews.text: People are so very right. The Gel Nimbus 19 has been made smaller. Previous versions very perfect on my feet. Moving to the 19s, too tight at the tip. I do not have wide feet either. Size 10.5 is too big. I loved, loved, lived the Gel Nimbus until version 19. I under pronate and switched from another brand due to foot issues. The Nimbus models, prior to 19, instantly resolved foot pain. I have been wearing since 2015. I found the Gel Quantum to be a replacement for the Nimbus. If the Quantums get tight, I will have to switch brands. Unless there is another sneaker model for people who under pronate.
customer_reviews.author: T. List

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers before me
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers before me ... ASICs changed their sizing such that their wide 4E shoes are the same size as other Width D shoes. Is there a 6E or 8E width? They are so narrow, I'm even wondering if there is any difference in width between their D, 2E, and 4E shoes. I've been a fan of the ASICs cumulus and nimbus shoes for the past 15 years. Would appreciate feedback regarding alternatives for folks with fat feet. The picture shows the difference in width between the new Nimbus 10-4E (on the left) and the older Cumulus 10-4E on the right. Huge!
customer_reviews.author: KarlT

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are BAD for a reason
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are BAD for a reason, listen to them! I've bought a new pair of this model for the last 5 yrs and something has changed with these! Super narrow and super small! I ordered a 13 and these are like at least a size smaller. Not sure why they changed something good, but they lost a devoted Gel-Nimbus customer! After some research I landed on the ONEMIX brand. Better than these GEL-Nimbus as they actually fit and cost A LOT lower, do yourself a favor and research these shoes! I hope ASICS get their S together as these shoes are the worst design ever.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Ford

customer_reviews.title: Order 1/2 size up, but comfortable shoe for neutral runners
customer_reviews.text: I am a neutral runner with previous knee and back injuries. During a gait analysis leading up to a surgery, the Gel Nimbus was recommended to distribute impact and help prevent pain while running. I started with the 17's and these are replacing those. They do reduce pain and felt impact while maintaining good road feel - enough so that I stuck with the Gel Nimbus. The 19 does feel different than the 17 though. A little more narrow in the toe box, a little stiffer in the heel but still feel good. Definitely need to order 1/2 size up or your toes may feel crowded in the box.
customer_reviews.author: M Neville

customer_reviews.title: Much tighter fit, much harder "ride"-- a loser.
customer_reviews.text: The Gel-Nimbus 19 is has a much smaller toe box and a much harder "ride" than at least the 4 or 5 previous Gel-Nimbus versions (15-18, say). If this was a conscious decision by Asics, it was a bad one, and was not communicated. If it was lack of design control, it's incompetent. I call it a bad shoe. Customer service had a solution: just buy the 20-- it will be better! They promise. I don't think I will follow their advice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Nimbus 19s. I different shoes for different types of running. These are great for everyday training and long distance races. Best shoes I've ever owned. Very comfortable. I tend to under-pronate slightly due to my "highish" arches and the soles are designed to guide your foot strike correctly which seems to correct that. The only suggestion I would make to improve them is to make them lighter, maybe less cushion at the arches and heels.
customer_reviews.author: P. Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: As many others reviewers warned this shoe, the ASICS Men's Gel-Nimbus 19 Running Shoe, is at least half a size if not a whole size too small. I should have listened. I should have ordered a size larger. As for now I hope lacing these very loosely and not wearing them for much time in a row will work for the duration of its lifetime; I hate shipping things back. ASICS have traditionally have made consistently great shoes. I am disappointed with my.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Gel Nimbus 18 > Gel Nimbus 19
customer_reviews.text: Been a longtime ASICS wearer. Like others have mentioned this show does seem to be tighter in mesh toes than previous models. I did not up my size and still able to wear. While running i haven’t noticed any issues, however when doing other exercise machines such as an elliptical my feet periodically fall asleep at times. This didn’t happen with the 18s or earlier so I’m guessing it’s having something to do with the tighter fit in the toes. This is unfortunate as I may need to start looking at other brands for future shoes if the small trend continues.
customer_reviews.author: bonez100

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with minor fit issues.
customer_reviews.text: Bought at a size larger than typical (12 rather than 11) and two sizes wider (4E rather than D). The 2E that wasn't available for my size would probably be closer to the D size as the 4E is slightly wide but still fits with abnormal shoe string tightening. So.. minus a star for non-standard (even for Asics) sizing. Otherwise, it's a great shoe. Extremely comfortable and light-weight. Review by intended wearer, Michelle's husband.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Weatherson

customer_reviews.title: This style wears out TOO fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing ASICS running shoes exclusively for the last 20+ years. ASICS has always had a rep for not holding up well, but I have tolerated this. This particular 19 style wears out especially fast. I bought two pairs, one for running/training and one to be seen in public. The running pair already has loss of the silver finish and the darker outer mesh has worn through in two places after a three months or so! I am enclosing a photo. What one can't see well are the wear areas of mesh on the lateral areas near the small toe. They are present on both sides. Nimbus 19 may be OK, but avoid this style!
customer_reviews.author: Fun Fong Jr. MD

customer_reviews.title: It's great shoes but it fits somewhat smaller
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing ASICS Gel-Nimbus 17 &18, size 8, so I order the same size for 19. It's great shoes but it fits somewhat smaller, feels & looks slimmer than Gel-Nimbus 17&18. Not entirely uncomfortable while wearing it, but I would recommend order half size up just to give a bit more room, especially if you are running long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: fit too tight
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in a ASICS gel cumulus and gel nimbus size 13D for about the last ten years. Something happened with the shoes in the past three years and 13D is now too tight. I have tried ASICS 13 E and it is too wide. So I will wear the less supportive ASIC's insert that comes with the shoe and wear thinner socks. I also have tried some of the methods posted on-line to gently expand a tight shoe and a few have helped.
customer_reviews.author: JJH

customer_reviews.title: Good for people with arthritis and low back issues- I recommend replacing shoe laces because they will break.
customer_reviews.text: Like most: These shoes were recommended by PT. I work in warehouse 60 hrs a week. I have arthritis in both knees and herniated discs and arthritis in lower back. I are very comfortable and reduce impact on joints. Like least: Shoe laces break! These are premium sneakers with very cheap laces! The padding breaks down in a few months. I believe that is a common problem for most running shoes. I will consider cheaper alternatives since I have to spend more money on shoes and I will only get about 3 months out of these sneakers because of padding.
customer_reviews.author: George Wright

customer_reviews.title: it would be comfortable. Made the mistake of running with them on ...
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem with ASIC's sizing. This and another ASIC shoe I ordered at the same time were about 1/2 size too small and narrow. If this shoe fit, it would be comfortable. Made the mistake of running with them on the track (thinking I could break them in), so I couldn't return them.
customer_reviews.author: brockap

customer_reviews.title: I liked them so much I bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes for my 190# body. The gel heel really cushions the impact on by bad knees. Others have mentioned that they run small and I cannot speak to that as this is the first pair of Asics I have purchased. I can say that I wear a 12M in Merrel and an 11-1/2M in Nike and UA, so take that for what it's worth. I liked them so much I bought a second pair and now that the prices are dropping I'm looking for a third pair.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle G

customer_reviews.title: Something has changed, not my favorite shoe any longer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used ASICS Nimbus since the 14, so it has been many years. I’ve always loved the show until 19. The shoe was too tight and for the first time in my running career I damaged the toenail on my big toe in a half marathon. I think they shrunk the toe box. I’m think I may stick up on some 17s if I can find them. Disappointed customer.
customer_reviews.author: E. Vicknair

customer_reviews.title: Nimbus 18 better fit than the 19 for 2E width
customer_reviews.text: I went from Gel-Nimbus 18 to the 19, ordered the same size as previous shoe, 9.5 2E, and this one is definitely smaller in the toe box. I am ordering the 9.5 4E and hoping for a better fit. Not sure why they would shrink the box from one generation to the next, but I am not so happy. Hoping the 4E arrives and I can have faith again in Asics!!
customer_reviews.author: Scoot and Ludie

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on clouds
customer_reviews.text: Best walking and running shoe, like walking on clouds. I have extra wide (4E feet) , and I agree the shoe is still a little on the narrow side, so I recommend those with similar feet buying half a size or one size larger. Still, they look great and are really comfy, and over one year later 10000 to 12000 steps a day, as many as 18000 in one day, they still look great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Chang

customer_reviews.title: Is Asics, not Asic
customer_reviews.text: Well, Asics is a remarkable brand, Amazon much more ... but, how is it possible to sell shoes what does not respect the brand ?. One of these shoes have written the brand Asic inside, not Asics. Please, I deserve respect and this is ridiculous. For me is very important the quality and the design in any product. Amazon care the custumer like no one on the earth, and I dont know if I feel betrayed or simply a jest.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Vera Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: 1 month old and the fabric is ripping in multiple areas!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well and my husband has been wearing Asics for years. However, after 1 month of wearing these, the fabric around the top of the sneaker has ripped in several places and the sneakers look like they are 4 years old. Not the quality expected from a pair of sneakers that cost $144! We have called Asics regarding this and they have not yet replied. Needless to say, after years of wearing Asics, we have concluded that they are absolutely not worth the price! Now the hard part of trying to find a good sneaker...
customer_reviews.author: Michele Goitiandia

customer_reviews.title: Small toe area. Big toe will likely tear material
customer_reviews.text: Cushion and support is amazing. Again asics has done a great job of that. I have to give the front of the shoe a 1 rating though. The shoe is about half a size smaller than expected and so it leaves the toe area way too compact. They needed to lift up the toe area a bit because the material is way too soft that it feels like my big toe will tear straight through it after a few days... other than the toe area being cramped, it's a great shoe. I would recommend getting half a size up to compensate for the small front
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe albeit a bit narrow in the forefoot
customer_reviews.text: Small in the forefoot area - to narrow would be the best description. This is in comparison to other ASICS. I helped this by wearing a thinner sock. After break in they are getting better though. Would have to be more diligent in buying these again - meaning look more closely at the fit and compare to other running shoes. So, buyer beware. Nothing wrong with the shoe - just be aware of the fit when you try them on. I tried them on in the store and bought at Amazon because of the limited selection in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Great shoot for supination and heavy loads
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this shoe. I originally bought a 9.5 4E, but that was too small. Switched to a 10 4E and it fits great. I use them for all my walking... work, golf, whatever. I also over supinate (roll outward) and I was having all kinds of ankle and foot issues. I started making sure I was walking by hitting the balls of my feet first, and using these sneakers, and everything seems better now. I'm 340lbs too... so when I turn my ankle, it's harsh!
customer_reviews.author: 777twist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit. Just beware of that if you're looking ...
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE OF SIZE DIFFERENCE!! I am a huge gel-nimbus fan! I had the 18s and wore them out. I wanted another pair and found out they stopped making them, so I upgraded to the 19. I ordered the same size..... when they arrived and I tried them on, I found it was at least an enitre size too small, even though it was the "same size." Sent them back and ordered a size bigger and boom. Perfect fit. Just beware of that if you're looking into these that they literally run a size small from the 18s, so bump it up one.. Love them. I wear custom orthotics, so I ordered a wide.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: These shoes hold that area of your foot more secure and I like that. They do form to your foot but ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ASICS running shoes for a number of years and typically replace after 300 miles or so. I've read that the Gel-Nimbus 19 is a tighter fit than the Gel-Nimbus 18 and I've found that is true specifically around the ball of my foot. These shoes hold that area of your foot more secure and I like that. They do form to your foot but I was able to run 3 miles out of the box without any hot spots or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Johndavidc

customer_reviews.title: ... had two pairs of these because they are very nice for Planter Fascias(which is the bane of my existence)
customer_reviews.text: I have had two pairs of these because they are very nice for Planter Fascias(which is the bane of my existence) .The only downside to these shoes are that the glue in the toe area that holds the sole to the actual shoe detaches before the sole is warn flat. First pair lasted 6 months, I also do 3 or more miles a day. I wear my shoes until they fail, my Brooks seem to last longer, but were not as comfortable as these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: devonoh

customer_reviews.title: Fit is weird compared to previous iterations of Gel Nimbus
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the Gel Nimbus for the past few years, but I don't like the 19s. The other reviewers say these run a size small - my normal 11.5s felt like I was falling off the front of the shoe, so I got the 12s and while they are better, they weirdly feel too long. It's like the front of the shoe is just too narrow and pointy. I wish I hadn't worn these outside - after the first run I wish I could return them.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: A bit tight, but, very good impact absorbsion.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of various "versions" of the Nimbus line of shoes. I really liked the earlier versions, but, not quite as happy with this version - 19. They seem to be the correct length, but, feel tighter around the foot even though I have ordered the same size each time and have adjusted the laces to where I am comfortable - just not quite the same feel when wearing them as I had anticipated. Not sure I will make this my running shoe of choice for my next pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ken & Kathie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. The comfort, the fit, the support; it’s all amazing. They are easy to keep clean and very breathable. These were true to size for me and I’ve bought two previous versions I’ve also loved. Highly recommend these to people with foot problems - I have a bunion on one foot and broke my other ankle and these provide me the necessary support to make it through long days of standing with little to no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie J

customer_reviews.title: many years and have always been pleased. Believe all the reviews that say Asics shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Have owned Asics for many, many years and have always been pleased. Believe all the reviews that say Asics shoes are not the same as previous years. I even ordered a half size bigger after reading the reviews and they are still way too narrow and do not fit right in the toes. Something has changed with Asics - they're either designed different or being made somewhere different now. Too uncomfortable to even wear casually. After over a decade of commitment to only Asics I am now forced to go to a different company. What happened?????
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Fit is different the previous versions.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product a 3 star rating because its a nice shoe. unfortunately they don't fit like the previous versions of the model of shoe. i have the Gel-Nimbus 16's and they fit great. this version isn't the same size toes were at the end of the shoe and the width is narrower the the previous versions. not a good fit and unfortunately the don't make the color that i bought in a wider width. sure wish these would have fit like the previous versions!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S.

customer_reviews.title: Nimbus still great despite a narrower toe box than the 18.
customer_reviews.text: Run on average of 9-15 miles a week. I love all the color variations in the Nimbus line and the 19's are no different. I've worn Nimbus for 8 years and they keep me coming back. Many reviews will point out the narrower toe box then in previous model's which I will definitely agree with. The 18's which I own a pair of are the last of the roomier toe box. That being said, I'm still extremely happy with my purchase. If you're not a runner and just like high quality comfortable athletic shoes then this is it.
customer_reviews.author: victor rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have a low arch so these shoes are so comfortable for me. They correct my walk and cause me to feel better not only in my feet but also my knees and back. I love all the bright colors they offer. The only thing that I was upset about is that I could not find my shoe in a women size so I had to buy mens. These shoes usually last me a good year before the soles loose some of the arch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It said this was a great shoe for plantar facitis because of the support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on several reviews and recommendations from rating sites and running sites. It said this was a great shoe for plantar facitis because of the support. I just didn’t get that support. It’s a comfy shoe, but not as wonderful as promoted. I still think the GT1000 was a great shoe. I’m not sure which edition of the 1000 it is, but it gray and neon green/yellow. I’ve tried several pairs of the Asics but nothing compares to the 1000s I had.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: more narrow design compared to the GN-18
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Gel Nimbus 18 and loved them. Very limited supply of the 18 so the 19 seemed logical. Exact same size I ordered in August in the 18 was significantly more narrow in the front of the shoe in the Gel Nimbus 19. Disappointed, but still great shoes. I was hoping for the easy way out in just ordering, but looks like I'll have to go get sized in the 19.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but if your are upgrading from Gel-Nimbus 18 of below get a size larger.
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, but as other reviews have said if you are upgrading from the Gel-Nimbus 18 get a full size larger show. In my case I have been wearing Gel-Nimbus size 13 since version 15, however size 13 for the version 19 shoes was uncomfortable. A few months ago I was able to find 13 Wide which fit well, but no one seems to stock those anymore. However, size 14 fit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Review dude

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the Nimbus series for several years. They fit perfectly from day one. This model was purchased in March. They have held up very well during that time. I am continuously on my feet for work for hours and these provide excellent support and comfort. After nine months of daily use I will be buying a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer jeannie macek

customer_reviews.title: Style and price over shoe color
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely pleased with how quickly the order was filled and shipped. This company gets my highest rating. I’ve worn this model of ASICS for years now. They are perfect for my high instep. Since I am less concerned about shoe color, and deeply concerned about the specific shoe type (asic nimbus gel), I was able to get these at an incredible price. Great company.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace C.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with the Asics Nimbus 19
customer_reviews.text: My biggest frustration with the Nimbus 19 is how much smaller they are compared to the Nimbus 18. The 19s I received are the same shoe size as my 18s, and while there is room in the toe box, the fit is significantly tighter. In other words, the length of the shoe is fine, but everything else is smaller. Two areas specifically: 1) around the middle of the foot they are more narrow, and 2) the height of the shoe, from bottom to top they are much tighter, especially around the balls of my heat. I'm regretting that I did not immediately return these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: I went to a sporting good store that carried that model so I could insure ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 9 pairs of training flats and one of them is the Nimbus 18. All of my shoes are size 10.5 and I didn't think there would be a problem ordering the Nimbus 19 in the same size. When I received them I couldn't believe how much smaller they were than my others. I went to a sporting good store that carried that model so I could insure the right size when I exchanged them. A size 11 fit just fine. I exchanged them with no difficulties. In the future, I will be sure to try them on at a store before purchasing them online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing a bit smaller than previous releases
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit snug and in line with other reviews. This is my 11th pair of Asics Gel-Nimbus from 14-19; all perfect fit except the 19 that is about a half size smaller. Understand that Asics heard the complaints and adjusted accordingly on release 20. I did not bother to exchange because I can still comfortably wear this pair with thinner socks
customer_reviews.author: William E. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect in every way, this is my third pair and the fit is the same every time. They have a soft landing but at the same time stiff, no ankle twist, and flexible. I wear orthotics because of an ankle issue and the Asics, recommended by my practitioner, resolved all of the knee and ankle pain. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: The 19 does run a little smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I like many other reviewers have bought the Nimbus line for many years and I always took a size 10. I read the reviews that the 19s were smaller than the 18s but ignored them, and I ended up having to return them for a half size larger. The 10 1/2 fits just fine although I also agree that they do not feel as cushiony as before. We will see what happens after a few wears and some miles.
customer_reviews.author: Lilac

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these for running and was skeptical but once they arrived and he had tried them on, he fell in love. He wears then strictly for running. Sprinting and long distance. He says he loves the way they feel and definitely thinks it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney/Steven

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand how you take a winner in every way and make the toe box narrower than previous editions. For the last several models, sizing was absolutely perfect. In fact I would buy multiple pairs just to avoid taking a chance on a model changing. Well its time to look for a new ride.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Tad narrow.
customer_reviews.text: On first try, definitely a tighter squeeze for my wide feet even in the 4E option. Not terribly uncomfortable, and will probably stretch out, but when I compared side-by-side with my old pair of Nimbus 18s, there is definitely a difference in the width of the design. Cusion feels great so far though, which is what I need most for my runs.
customer_reviews.author: Keshav Fulbrook

customer_reviews.title: Size issues
customer_reviews.text: Normally I am size 10.5 in other ASICS models. After reading the reviews for the Gel-Nimbus 19 I ordered 11 - but there are still way too small. I would probably need 11.5 or even 12. ASICS should perform a serious effort to standardize sizes across their models. I will have to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Bradman

customer_reviews.title: Is it just me?
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair in the gel-nimbus line and my pair is slightly more narrow than my 2 pairs of gel-nimbus 18. Not a comple deal breaker but a little disappointing as my 2 pairs of 18 have been heaven-sents in dealing with plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hauss

customer_reviews.title: Not like they use to be
customer_reviews.text: This brand a style use to be the best running shoe, from around 2008 to 2015. And now that I get online and buy the same brand and similar type and they are different. They are a tight,stuffy lily fit shoes. I wish I had bought more of the old types before they were gone
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE

customer_reviews.title: ASICS screwed up their flagship trainer
customer_reviews.text: This was my goto running shoe that I always kept on hand for a comfortable cushiony ride over the long haul. After owning in the past more than 10 pairs of Nimbus, the size 9 ordered was a half size too small. So I returned them for a 9.5, which feels too big. Not much of an issue for shorter distance runs but the extra length and weight at 20 miles+ feels like clodhoppers. Also, the new cushion design is a bit non-responsive and there are a many alternatives on the market, even among mid-level cushioned shoes, if a cushioned improved surface training ride is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Go Up Half a Size
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics for 25 years and went into a panic after reading the reviews. What to do? I didn't want to switch because these shoes have kept me injury free. So I went to a store and tried them. Yes, they were tight in the toe-box. I ordered a half-size up and that worked out perfectly. It felt like the same old Nimbus 18 to me. I run every other day and no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Rethink your size before ordering Nimbus 19's!
customer_reviews.text: Initial feel is all wrong in these. I have run 1500+ miles a year for 6-8 years all in Asics Nimbus size 11 and these shoes are making think of checking out other brands. Toe box is SUPER tight and show feels small all over. Feels like my big toes are going to slide off the sole they are so narrow. Not sure if I will return them or see if they break in at all.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Lerum

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizer, Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The looks and overall fit of this shoe were great. It stabilizes well for over pronation due to pain from heel spurs. I couldn't keep the shoes because I ordered a size that fit a bit too snug for me. My wife has the exact same shoes and loves them. She has nearly ruptured tendons and these saved her life. She likes the snug fit. Other than that, a perfect shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Same great shoe as always!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to order these shoes in the regular size as some reviews stated the fit was different, however I ordered the same size as my last Asics and was happy to find they fit just as well as my last shoes. Great for my nightly walks.
customer_reviews.author: Cali B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent show
customer_reviews.text: I'm approaching 20,000 miles run over four decades. I run exclusively on indoor tracks and prefer a shoe with a soft strike. Stability for running outside on uneven surfaces isn't a priority. Asics' Nimbus style seems to work best for me. I'm a true 10 for street shoes. The Nimbus 10 fits a bit snug which is my preference as I use ultra thin Balega socks. Excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kanotna

customer_reviews.title: To short and to narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of nimbus 18 size 10.5 standard width that need replaced. I am on my feet 10 hour a day and the nimbus 18 are great. I purchased the nimbus 19 size 10.5 and they were way to short and narrow. Did not feel comfortable at all. I sent them back and purchased the Asics nimbus 20 size 10.5 WIDE, and they still feel more narrow than the nimbus 18. Hopefully Asics realizes they had things on spot with the design of the nimbus 18.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits VERY Small
customer_reviews.text: I've been running on Asics Nimbus for at least 5 years and upgraded the 19 in spring of 2018. They seemed to fit small but I figured I'd been running in the Nimbus for many years and they couldn't have changed that much. After running in them for a few months I developed a BAD case of Plantar Fasciitis. Ended up getting a full refit at a local running store and moved to the New Balance 880, I'll never buy Asics again after this fit fiasco. It makes no sense to change sizing so drastically within a model.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Zinkweg

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: I,ve had these running shoes for two weeks and actually like them better than the 18, which I have. I'm thankful for the reviews which stated the sizes run small. I ordered a half a size larger and went from 2E to 4E. They fit perfect. They are more comfortable than my previous pair ever were.I didn't give them a 5 star since it's only been a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Had to upsize for proper fit. Disappointed with ASICS 2017!product.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat disappointed with ASICS. After reading blogs I found that 2017 product shifted from China to Vietnam manufacture and sizing was tighter in front of shoe. Bought my size originally but had to return and get the next size up. I’ve been buying the gel nimbus for several years without any issue except this year.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Too tight in toe box
customer_reviews.text: New narrow cut in toe box. I got this to replace the Gel-Nimbus 18, but it was too tight to use for running. Sent back for refund. I like Asics and wish they would not follow the narrow toe-box trend and go back to the older styles. The fit, and not the quality, is the reason for my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Silversmith

customer_reviews.title: Is the Gel Nimbus 19 Smaller Than Previous Models?
customer_reviews.text: They are smallish compared to past gel nimbus models. I put in the inserts from previous pairs to see if it worked better than the paper this model was plugged with. I have bought lots of Asics gel nimbus shoes, at least five or six pairs a year, because I wear them with orthotic inserts while working as a tennis pro. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt. It's a terrific pain to try to return shoes. The star rating of 3 reflects uncertainty, not precision.
customer_reviews.author: jimsloan

customer_reviews.title: It's like wearing a slipper
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I have Achilles and heel issues and this feels like a good shoe for that. My only complaint is the toe box is a little snug. I had to go up to the 4E to feel the most comfortable. Once you put this on your foot though, it's very comfortable. Almost feels like you're wearing a slipper with a running shoe sole. It envelops your foot without placing pressure on it. It's quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grady

customer_reviews.title: Foot relief
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I suffered on and off all summer from plantars faciitus. Two weeks since I started wearing these while running, and my foot pain has gone away. First few days did require some ‘breaking in’ (wore while walking, then on short runs). Now I am very happy that I found these and purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Buoyant

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size too small. It’s going back.
customer_reviews.text: I had the ASIC Nimbus Gel-18 in size 11.5 and they fit great. This is basically the newer version and the sizing was 1/2 size too small. Amazon size estimator thingy even told me to go with size 11.5. Returning these for size 12, which I think will fit.
customer_reviews.author: JDog

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd pair, loved the first 2
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed that these are my 3rd pair and the first 2 were my absolute favorite running shoe. These felt the same but after putting about 25 miles on them I started getting blisters on my right heel so they fit nearly the same as before but just not perfect. Still a quality shoe just have to work around the differences in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Walking on Concrete Flat Surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ASICS Men's Gel-Nimburs 19 Running shoe because I alot of running and walk, and stand all day at work. After working all day on my feet, this shoe is still keeping my feet comfortable, and very little foot pain. The gel technology in the shoe is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelYancey

customer_reviews.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Nimbus 19 Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: It's no secret that the ASICS Men's Gel-Nimbus 19 Running Shoe run small. These were no exception, they are slightly narrower than I would have liked, but if they follow the same pattern of previous pairs, they should stretch slightly during the break-in period.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Shoes like Boa Constrictors.
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these shoes in a car and within two hours is complaining of blisters forming on his toe. This is the 6th pair of gel-nimbus in size11 4-E that he's had and the only pair to make his feet feel like they're in a special kind of jail for bad feet. As soon as i can, I'll be returning these boa constrictors.
customer_reviews.author: CasaMcN

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these twice to get the right size (I take a 10.5 and had to order a 12 to fit comfortably). Still wish the toebox was wider like the older models.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: ... on his feet a lot and these shoes are great, BUT they do not last
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on his feet a lot and these shoes are great, BUT they do not last. We have to buy a new pair every 4 months. Fabric on the outside of the shoe splits. But they are the only shoes that give him comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Martha J. Harden

customer_reviews.title: and I loved them. They were a perfect fit (12
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Nimbus 17s, and I loved them. They were a perfect fit (12.5D). I was excited to be able to buy another pair without going to the store, but the tie box (and the whole shoe) is a good bit narrower with the Nimbus 19. Bummer. Still soft and a good running shoe - just wish they would go back to their old sizing.
customer_reviews.author: David M Popoli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit/comfort
customer_reviews.text: The men's 8.5 fit me better than womens 10 for some reason. Have had this shoe before and I found it to be the most comfortable running shoe I have ever had. I use them just for walking.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie gildea

customer_reviews.title: Shoes running too small. Buy a bigger size.
customer_reviews.text: I have just returned my shoes to the vendor because they were too small. I have been buying ASICS Nimbus since I don't remember when and it has always worked well for my. My size is 9, but this new version is definitely running a smaller size. I even went to a Dick's store to try a 9,5 and it did fit very comfortable on my feet. Too bad they did not have the color I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. O. Costa

customer_reviews.title: Nimbus 19 is a Disaster
customer_reviews.text: The 19 is a terrible shoe. I bought it and wore it on a 12 mile run to try it out and it kills my Achilles owing to pressure. I have been wearing ASICS Nimbus for many years in the same size and never a problem until now. Stay clear of this model and go back to the Nimbus 17 which was a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Warwick Ford, Author, the Fun on Foot Books

customer_reviews.title: I really like these running shoes but I do find that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these running shoes but I do find that I need to be extra careful in breaking them in so they don’t hurt my feet when I run. I do that by using them for every day wear for a little while before I run in them. This might also solve the problem for some people who say they’re too tight. During the break in period they are a little snug but not uncomfortably so unless you run in them fresh out of the box. I just use my previous pair of basically the same shoe until I accomplish that .
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: No more Asics for me, no longer any better than shoes for 1/2 the price...
customer_reviews.text: AMAZON...Why not notify buyers that Asics shoes made in Vietnam will run at least a full size to small and 10-15% narrower than stated? Padding on tongue way to thin. Shoe a big letdown, and returned
customer_reviews.author: sore feet

customer_reviews.title: fav running shoes
customer_reviews.text: nimbus series is one of few that we supinators can wear, and these ones have great cushion and rebound in the soles. i do a few miles during lunch breaks 2-3 days/week, and buy these shoes annually. once retired from running they still look fine so I use for casual stomping around
customer_reviews.author: krahnik

customer_reviews.title: I like them but decided to upgrade to the ASIC Gel ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had Asic shoes several times and bought them at Kohl’s before. I like them but decided to upgrade to the ASIC Gel 19 shoe and ordered them through Amazon as I had a hard time finding the black color in the stores. I love shoes but after a little over 3 months I find part of the bottom wedges are separating and coming apart, which is why I am rating it a 2. Never had this problem with my other ASIC Gel 18s. Too bad as the fit and comfort is great. I am 6-1 and 215 so I needed a good support shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order 1 Size Larger
customer_reviews.text: I took other reviewers' advice when placing my order and selected 1 size larger than my last Gel-Nimbus pair and that did the trick me. They fit exactly like my old pair of Nimbus 17s. However based on what others have said, your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Kemis

customer_reviews.title: ASICS has fine something with the sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed again with ASICS. This is the second pair I bought online that I had to return. Not sure what they did but I have a few in size 8 1/2 that fit perfect. Now they seem to be too tight. Went to a retailer and it was the same. Beware before purchasing, altough I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Light
customer_reviews.text: Light and comfortable, very good cushioning. Toe box is narrow and knowing this I ordered a 1/2 size larger and it fits perfect. One of the most comfortable out of box running shoe I have experienced. Seems to be well constructed and durable but have not put it to the test yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great Trainer for High Mileage Neutral Runners
customer_reviews.text: The Nimbus is still the Rolls Royce of the Asics neutral road shoe line. Its a very plush and comfortable shoe. Great for when you are piling on a lot of miles when training for a marathon! They still tend to run a little narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Flanagan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Order half size longer and wider.
customer_reviews.text: Although there is some controversy on sizing, the GN-19 fits me like a slipper with a comfortable margin. I did order half size longer and wider. Compared to the GN-18, there is some change in the foot but I'll run some before I decide. I'm 40 years street running, down to 12 miles a week at 8 minute miles, 2-3 10K races a year, and I'm sticking with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Constance McLennan

customer_reviews.title: Sizing a bit off?
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the very same shoes in blue fit better. Maybe the factory is different or the shoe last is different. This particular pair is a bit too large and will have to be returned. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: CorgisRock!

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have the shoes I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes arrived in a very timely manner and were exactly what I wanted. I had tried shoes just like them in 3 different stores, but I could not find my very common size. I ordered them and now have the exact shoes I wanted. They are so neat and fit in with most any outfit I wear outside.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but run small
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, many of which mentioned that these shoes run small, I decided to order a size up. I normally wear a 13EEEE, so I ordered a 14EEEE. Got them a few days ago and they fit and feel great. So my suggestion is to order either a half size or full size larger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: MeanMark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ASICS fan
customer_reviews.text: Shoes ran really small. In non-running shoes I wear an 8 1/2. Historically in ASICS I wore a 9 but more recently I have worn a 9 1/2 in other brands so I ordered a 9 1/2. These shoes were so small. They felt like an 8 (i.e. they felt smaller than my street shoes). So sad. I’ve moved away from ASICS recently because I wore through the heel cup material too fast. Thought I would try new version. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoe for Supinators
customer_reviews.text: Only shoe I have found that hasn't failed me due to supination (under-pronation) deformation of the sole with the outside edges wearing out prematurely. Use this shoe for walking 15-20 miles/week for fitness at a fast pace just short of jogging.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Color true to Picture
customer_reviews.text: go up a half size or shoe will be too tight, otherwise love my Asics Gel Nimbus Shoes...I am an RN, on my feet all day and I have worn these shoes going back to the GN15 I think, so many years and my feet feel good at end of day. BTW I have very little arch as in flat feet and these shoes work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caution, they run small
customer_reviews.text: Quality seemed okay but, after owning six pairs of Nimbus 17's and Nimbus 18's in size 11M, the sizing on the Nimbus 19's are a half size smaller than previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Ball

customer_reviews.title: is the best training shoe for track athletes
customer_reviews.text: I believe that the 19's run a little small. I coach HS girls, and it is my belief that the Nimbus, because of the shock absorption in the forefoot area, is the best training shoe for track athletes. Plus great stability! Most of my girls ask their college coaches can the still workout and train in the Nimbus. They reluctantly let them do it. At track meet they have to wear the universities sponsored brand.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Ray

customer_reviews.title: 5d and it was tight around my foot so I tried a 2E which fits good. I measured the insoles which are identical
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear 8.5d in athletic shoes which is a full size over my dress leather shoes. I ordered a 8.5d and it was tight around my foot so I tried a 2E which fits good. I measured the insoles which are identical. The 2E is just roomier around the top. Like the shoe but had a to go with a wide.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I’ve ever owned...
customer_reviews.text: These are the most incredible, comfortable running shoes I’ve ever owned. Based on some other reviews, I decided to go a half size larger than my normal shoe size, and they feel absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walker

customer_reviews.title: I love Asics Nimbus shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Asics Nimbus shoes, and my size varies in it from 9.5 2E in the 18 to 10 4E for the 19. In these sizes for each version, they fit well and great shoes - durable and comfortable. I'm not an avid runner, but use these for cross-training exercises.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: My 23rd pair
customer_reviews.text: love these. I have a wide foot 4E. ASICS are my favorite and these are one of best fit and fell shoes I have had in a while. Look good to.My 23rd pair of ASICS.
customer_reviews.author: FARMERTIM

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Nimbus 19 Running Shoe
product_meta.description:
The GEL-Nimbus 19 shoe features our revolutionary flytefoam technology, for optimal comfort and a responsive ride for the neutral runner. A gradient jacquard-mesh upper is strategically tightened or loosened in zones to allow the foot's natural motion. 3D printed overlays provide seamless support to the upper.Heel Height: 23mm.

In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
feature_bullets: FlyteFoam Midsole Technology ; ASICS GEL-Nimbus 19 is made for under- Foot Type:High arches , neutral- Foot Type:Normal size arches ; Heel Height: 23mm ; ASICS FluidFit upper technology combines multi-directional stretch mesh with stretch reinforcements that adapt to the athlete's foot, creating a truly customized glove-like fit.
Fluid Ride Midsole: Fluid Ride provides the ultimate combination of bounce back and cushioning properties with reduced weight and exceptional durability.
Rear foot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
Rear foot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
Heel Clutching System Technology: Exoskeletal heel counter provides improved support and creates improved heel fitting environment.
